bdm 1.0.0

Extract log-normal parameters for the prior on intrinsic growth rate \(r\)

Source: R/getr.R
getr.Rd

When applied to a bdm class object the function uses regular expression matching to extract log-normal distribution parameters for \(r\) from the model code.

By default the bdm package assumes that the prior on intrinsic growth rate can be described by a log-normal distribution with parameters \(\mu\) and \(\sigma\), which correspond to the mean and standard deviation of \(\ln(r)\).

Usage

getr(object, ...)

# S3 method for class 'bdm'
getr(object, ...)

Arguments

object

an object of the appropriate class

...

additional arguments to generic function

Value

A list containing the elements 'E[log(r)]' (equal to \(\mu\)), 'SD[log(r)]' (equal to \(\sigma\)), 'E[r]', 'VAR[r]' and 'CV[r]'.

Examples

# default model
mdl <- bdm()

# extract r from
# bdm object
getr(mdl)
#> $`E[log(r)]`
#> [1] -1
#> 
#> $`SD[log(r)]`
#> [1] 0.2
#> 
#> $`E[r]`
#> [1] 0.3753111
#> 
#> $`VAR[r]`
#> [1] 0.005748541
#> 
#> $`CV[r]`
#> [1] 0.2020168
#>
